title: Define first-session objective contract for the playable slice loop
description: Document one canonical first-session objective sequence (tick/build/train/scout/attack/resolve) mapped to canonical-default event keys and required token fields so backend/frontend/content share the same in-slice progression contract.
acceptance_criteria: A first-session objective table exists with ordered steps for tick/build/train/scout/attack/resolve and stable objective identifiers
Each objective step references canonical-default content keys and required runtime token names from the first-slice matrix
Post-slice mechanics (heroes/ambush/gather branches) are explicitly marked deferred and excluded from required objective coverage

title: Align narrative placeholder rows to first-session objective outcomes
description: Update first-slice narrative seed rows so each objective step has canonical success/failure placeholder coverage (including key negative states) with token fields aligned to the objective contract and loop token matrix.
acceptance_criteria: Canonical placeholder rows cover objective-step outcomes for success plus at least one negative case per loop family (insufficient_resources/cooldown/invalid_target/combat_loss)
Token placeholders for each row match required token names in the canonical matrix and objective contract
No new out-of-scope key families are added to default first-session coverage

title: Enforce objective contract parity in first-slice seed validation
description: Extend backend first-slice validation so objective contract key references, canonical-default usage, and token requirements are checked against the content-key manifest and narrative seed rows with deterministic diagnostics.
acceptance_criteria: Validation fails when any objective step references a content key missing from manifest or seed rows
Validation fails when objective defaults reference compatibility-only keys instead of canonical-default keys
Failure output includes objective id, key, and missing token details for one-pass correction

title: Render first-session objective strip in client shell from canonical keys
description: Implement a lightweight objective strip in the web client that displays step progression for the first-session loop using canonical objective keys and existing action outcomes without introducing new mechanics.
acceptance_criteria: Client shell shows an ordered first-session objective strip for tick/build/train/scout/attack/resolve steps with clear active/completed states
Objective rendering resolves canonical-default keys and does not promote compatibility-only aliases for default display
When expected objective template data is missing, UI falls back to deterministic placeholder text and keeps the loop interactive

title: Add deterministic release-candidate prep command for web and wrapper lanes
description: Create one canonical prep command/script that refreshes first-slice frontend manifest artifacts and then runs Steam/Android wrapper prepare lanes in deterministic order for reproducible local release-candidate packaging.
acceptance_criteria: A single documented command refreshes first-slice manifest artifacts before running Steam and Android wrapper prepare commands
Prep flow exits non-zero on stage failure and prints per-stage status in deterministic order
Platform metadata/assets remain explicitly placeholder-only and replaceable

title: Run release-blocking first-slice gate after objective-contract tranche
description: Execute the release gate after objective-contract design/content/backend/frontend/platform changes and publish PASS/FAIL evidence with owner-tagged blockers for any failing mandatory stage.
acceptance_criteria: Gate evidence records PASS/FAIL for playable, quality, platform, and hostile_token_contract stages after tranche updates
Any failing mandatory stage includes exact failing command and explicit owner_role blocker assignment
No additional non-critical QA-only tasks are generated unless a release-blocking failure is observed
